children.name: to make sure that sth is true or correct
double-check
children.definition: to check something a second time, so that you are completely sure: kiểm tra lại

children.name: ▪‘Did you switch the heating off?’ ‘Yes, I double-checked.’
examples: ▪ I don’t think I made a mistake. I checked and double-checked all my calculations.

children.name: double-check that kiểm tra lại xem
examples: ▪Double-check that the computer file was properly copied.

children.name: verify
children.definition: to officially check afactorstatementand show that it is correct:
examples: xác nhận, xác minh, kiểm tra
▪You can verify the facts in the report by calling his office.
Bạn có thể xác minh các sự kiện trong báo cáo bằng cách gọi văn phòng của anh ấy
verify that xác minh rằng
▪ Doctors have verified that the injury was indeed work-related.
Các bác sĩ đã xác minh rằng thương tích thực sự có liên quan đến công việc.
verification/ˌverɪfəˈkeɪʃən, ˌverəfəˈkeɪʃən/ [uncountable noun]
xác minh
▪The documents are being sent to the State Department for verification.
The documents are being sent to the State Department for verification.

children.name: make sure
children.definition: /make certain  to check that asituationis really the way you want or expect it to be: chắc chắn đảm bảo
examples: ▪I don’t think Jo’s back yet, but you can knock on her door just to make sure.
Tôi không nghĩ rằng Jo đã trở lại, nhưng bạn có thể gõ cửa cô để chắc chắn.

children.name: make sure/make certain (that) chắc chắn rằng, đảm bảo rằng
examples: ▪ Make certain the car is in good condition before you sign the rental agreement.
Hãy chắc chắn rằng xe của bạn đang ở trong tình trạng tốt trước khi bạn ký hợp đồng cho thuê.
▪ I phoned the hotel to make sure that they had reserved a room for us.
Tôi gọi cho khách sạn để đảm bảo rằng họ đã dành một chỗ cho chúng tôi.

children.name: check
children.definition: to do something in order to find out whether something is really true or correct: kiểm tra

children.name: ▪ ‘Are you sure this is the right phone number?’ ‘Yes, I’ve just checked.’
examples: ▪ You’d better check the figures one more time - we don’t want any mistakes.

children.name: check that
examples: ▪I’ll just check that I locked the door.
▪ Check that the meat is cooked thoroughly before serving it.

children.name: check if/whether
examples: ▪ Before your trip, check if your insurance covers you abroad.

children.name: check to see if/whether
examples: ▪Let’s check to see if she’s OK.

children.name: ascertain
children.definition: to find out if a fact that you think is true is really true:
examples: tìm hiểu, xác định
ascertain something xác định cái gì
▪The case remains a mystery. The police were never able to ascertain the true facts.
Vụ án vẫn còn là một bí ẩn. Cảnh sát không bao giờ có thể xác định được sự thật.
ascertain that xác định rằng
▪ The pathologist ascertained that the victim had died from a gunshot wound.
Nhà nghiên cứu bệnh học xác định chắc chắn rằng nạn nhân đã chết vì vết thương do súng đạn.
ascertain how/when/why etc xác định thế nào/ khi nào/ vì sao v.v
▪ A doctor should examine the patient to ascertain where the pain is localized.
Một bác sĩ nên kiểm tra bệnh nhân để xác định vết thương là cục bộ.
ascertain xác định
▪As far as we have been able to ascertain, our client is not involved in anything illegal.
Theo như chúng tôi đã có thể xác định, khách hàng của chúng tôi không tham gia vào bất cứ điều gì bất hợp pháp.

children.name: check out
children.definition: to make sure that the information, especially sth that sb else has told you, is actually true: kiểm tra lời ai đã nói
examples: We got in touch with the bank to check out the suspect’s story.
What he said didn’t seem quite right, so I decided to check it out.
We'll need to check out his story.

children.name: examination
children.definition: when sb looks at sth carefully and thoroughly to find out more about it: sự kiểm tra, xem xét
examples: The issues needfurther examination.
examination of
a detailed examination of population statistics
under examination
The proposals are still under examination.
The committee’s latest proposals are still under examination.
on closer examinationwhen examined more carefully
On closer examination the vases were found to be cracked in several places.
On closer examination the vases were seen to be cracked.

children.name: carry out an examination
children.definition: alsoconduct an examinationformal
examples: (= examine something )The police are carrying out an examination of the crime scene.

children.name: a careful examination
examples: After a very careful examination of the evidence, we have ruled against the defendant.

children.name: a detailed examination
examples: Scientists have carried out a detailed examination of the house.

children.name: a thorough/rigorous examination
children.definition: very careful
examples: There needs to be a thorough examination of these claims.

children.name: a close examination
children.definition: very careful and detailed
examples: A close examination of the figures revealed many discrepancies.

children.name: a brief examination
children.definition: quick, and not very detailed
examples: In chapter one, there is a brief examination of the economic situation in the country at the time.

children.name: a cursory examination
children.definition: very quick and not careful or detailed
examples: Even a cursory examination of the documents would reveal some serious problems.

children.name: a superficial examination
children.definition: looking only at things that are obvious and easy to see
examples: The police carried out a fairly superficial examination of the room.

children.name: a preliminary/initial examination
examples: The inland revenue began a preliminary examination of his tax returns in August.

children.name: further examination
children.definition: a more detailed or careful examination
examples: The results of the experiment merit further examination.

children.name: forensic examination
children.definition: the scientific methods used for finding out about a crime
examples: The clothing was sent to the lab for forensic examination.

children.name: on closer examination
examples: On closer examination, I could see a slight crack in the window.

children.name: under examination
examples: The handling of the matter is under examination by congressional investigators.

children.name: scrutiny
children.definition: careful and thorough examination of sth: sự xem xét kỹ lưỡng
examples: The company’s plans for expansion have attracted scrutiny from consumer groups.

children.name: come under scrutiny
children.definition: be examined
examples: The cost and efficiency of the health care system has come under increasing scrutiny.

children.name: be subjected to scrutiny
children.definition: be examined
examples: Each proposal was subjected to careful scrutiny.

children.name: be the subject of scrutiny
children.definition: be examined
examples: The way in which the courts handle such claims has been the subject of close scrutiny.

children.name: be subject to scrutiny
children.definition: be able to be examined
examples: All the accounts are subject to scrutiny by auditors.

children.name: be open to scrutiny
examples: Government actions should be more open to public scrutiny.

children.name: not stand up to scrutiny/not bear scrutiny
children.definition: be found to have faults when examined
examples: Such arguments do not stand up to careful scrutiny.

children.name: careful scrutiny
examples: These figures need careful scrutiny.

children.name: close/intense scrutiny
children.definition: very careful scrutiny
examples: Both these areas of law have come under close scrutiny by the courts.

children.name: rigorous/strict scrutiny
children.definition: very careful and thorough
examples: This system has been subject to rigorous scrutiny.

children.name: detailed scrutiny
examples: MPs on these committees subject Government bills to detailed scrutiny.

children.name: critical scrutiny
children.definition: when something is examined and judged or criticized
examples: Their work is in the public domain and open to critical scrutiny.

children.name: public scrutiny
children.definition: by the public
examples: Much of the work that we do is open to public scrutiny.

children.name: media scrutiny
children.definition: by newspapers, TV etc
examples: How does he cope with the intense media scrutiny?

children.name: parliamentary scrutiny
children.definition: by parliament
examples: The Labour Party expressed concern about the lack of parliamentary scrutiny of MI5.

children.name: judicial scrutiny
children.definition: by judges
examples: The new legislation will be the subject of close judicial scrutiny.

children.name: careful/close scrutiny
examples: Careful scrutiny of the company’s accounts revealed a whole series of errors.

children.name: scrutiny of
examples: Airlines have increased their scrutiny of the size and amount of carry-on luggage.

children.name: under scrutiny
examples: The city’s elections department has been under scrutiny since last year.

children.name: come under public scrutinybegin to be closely examined by people
examples: Once you become famous your private life comes under public scrutiny.

children.name: inspection
children.definition: thanh tra
examples: 1an official visit to a building or organization to check that everything is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed
inspection of
regular inspections of the prison
Aninspectionwascarried outat the school.
tour of inspection(= an official visit to inspect something )
2a careful examination of sth to find out more about it or to check for anything wrong
for inspection
Copies of the documents are available for inspection(= people can look at them )at local libraries.
(on) close/closer inspection(= when looked at in detail )
However, on closer inspection, a number of problems emerged.
Close inspection of the plane’s engines revealed several small defects.

children.name: a careful/detailed inspection
examples: The architect has now made his detailed inspection of the building.

children.name: a full inspection
examples: A full inspection of the site is due to be conducted.

children.name: a cursory inspectionformal
children.definition: a very quick and not very careful inspection
examples: He made only a cursory inspection of the truck.

children.name: an official inspection
examples: Preparations were made in advance of the official inspection.

children.name: a routine inspection
children.definition: an ordinary inspection that happens regularly
examples: A routine inspection revealed that several lorries were not roadworthy.

children.name: a daily inspection
examples: A young airman had carried out the daily inspection of the instruments.

children.name: an annual inspection
examples: The aircraft was due for its annual inspection.

children.name: regular/frequent inspections
examples: Restaurants are subject to regular health and safety inspections.

children.name: a safety inspection
examples: A safety inspection was carried out on the boiler system.

children.name: a school inspection
examples: The arrangements for school inspections have been greatly improved.

children.name: a weapons inspection
children.definition: to see what weapons someone has
examples: The government has agreed to allow UN weapons inspections in the country.

children.name: a medical inspection
examples: Schoolchildren had to undergo a compulsory medical inspection.

children.name: carry out an inspection
examples: Engineers had carried out an inspection on the plane.

children.name: conduct an inspectionformal
children.definition: carry out an inspection
examples: He was conducting an inspection in the factory.

children.name: do an inspectioninformal:
examples: We did the inspection last Friday.

children.name: complete/finish an inspection
examples: The inspection was completed and the relevant forms filled in.

children.name: pass an inspection
examples: The supermarket can only trade if it passes the cleanliness inspection.

children.name: fail an inspection
examples: He couldn’t join the army because he failed the medical inspection.

children.name: an inspection reveals something
examples: The inspection revealed several lapses in safety standards.

children.name: an inspection visit
examples: To date no inspection visit has been made.

children.name: a tour of inspection
children.definition: an official visit to inspect something
examples: Morris took off on his tour of inspection.

children.name: an inspection team
examples: The inspection team described the 1,688 pupil school as ‘outstanding’.

children.name: to make sure sth is safe, works correctly
check up on
children.definition: sb informal to check, especiallysecretly, that sb is doing what they are supposed to do:
examples: Some companies use hidden cameras in order to check up on their employees.

children.name: I just want to call home and check up on the kids
examples: My mum checks up on me most evenings to see that I've done my homework.

children.name: check
children.definition: an examination of something to make sure that it is correct, safe, or satisfactory:
examples: check on
▪ There are regular checks on the quality of goods leaving our factory.
carry out/run/do a check
make a check tiến hành kiểm tra
▪ All routine safety checks were carried out before the flight.
spot check kiểm tra tại chố
an unplanned check on a thing or person that is chosen from a group by chance
▪ Spot checks by customs officers led to the arrest of several drug smugglers.
background check kiểm tra danh tính
a check on what someone has done in the past
▪ The agency does background checks on all the nannies it hires
checknounEXAMINATIONkiểm tra;kiểm soát; kiểm lại; đánh dấu đã kiểm soát
[ C ] an examination of something in order to make certain that it is correct or the way it should be
_The soldiers gave their equipment a final check before setting off.
_"I can't find my keys." "Have another checkin/throughyour jacket pockets."
_Securitychecks have become really strict at the airport.
_The police are carrying outspotchecks on (= quick examinations of a limited number of) drivers over the Christmas period to test for alcohol levels.
_It's my job tokeepa checkonstock levels.
_I'll justruna checkon(= find information about) that name for you in the computer.

children.name: inspect
children.definition: to examine sth carefully to make sure that it is correct, safe, or working properly, especially when it is your job to do this: thanh tra
examples: The building is regularly inspected by a fire-safety officer.
Russian and American teams will have the right to inspect each other’s missile sites.
Some insurance people have already been here to inspect the damage caused by the storm.
I got out of the car toinspect the damage.
Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
inspect sth for sthin order to find something
All trucks coming through are inspected for mechanical violations.
The police will inspect the venue for safety.
RegisterIn everyday English, people usually saytake a look at something/somebodyor, in British English,have a look atsomething or someone rather thaninspectsomething or someone:
Can Itake a look atyour ticket, please?

inspect[T] to make an official visit to a building, organization etc to check that everything is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed - used especially about soldiers and about teachers in UK: thanh tra
General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
The school will be inspected in May.
inspector[C] B2 an official whose job is to check that something is correct, safe, or working properly: viên thanh tra
a Health and Safety inspector
ticket inspectors/ tax inspector
a school inspector/an inspector of schools
Standards of discipline at the school were strongly criticized in the inspector’s report.

children.name: check
children.definition: to look at sth carefully and thoroughly to make sure that it is correct, safe, or working properly: kiểm tra
examples: ▪ Their passports were checked by immigration officers at the airport.

children.name: check sth for sthin order to find something
examples: ▪ We need to check the building for structural damage.

children.name: to find out if there is anything wrong with sth
look over
children.definition: to quickly look at the details of sb or sth, especially before you officially agree to buy it, use it etc: xem qua
examples: We looked over several apartments before finally choosing this one.
If you want, I can look over your English homework for you.
Would you care to look the document over before you sign?
Jessica hated the way the men in the bar looked her over.
I’ve looked over all the records and they seem okay.
The book is expensive, so look it over to make sure it’s what you really want.

children.name: check over
children.definition: to quickly examine every part of sth to make sure that it is correct or safe: xem qua
examples: The editor always checks over what I’ve written.
I’m going to take the car in and ask the mechanic to check it over before we go on vacation.

children.name: scrutinize
children.definition: /scrutiniseUK  to examine sth very closely and carefully in order to find out whether there is anything wrong, especially because it is your official duty to do this: xem xét tỉ mỉ, soi, rà soát
examples: The coach’s assistants stood along the field and scrutinized every move we made.
The Federal Trade Commission is scrutinizing the proposed merger of the two companies.
He scrutinized the document.

children.name: go through
children.definition: / oversth to examine sth such as a document or plan thoroughly from beginning to end, especially in order to check that it iscorrect: xem xét toàn bộ
examples: I’d like to go over last month’s accounts with you.
You should still go through the contract with a lawyer before you sign.

children.name: to examine and check sth in general
examine
children.definition: to look at sb or sth extremelycarefully, especially because you want to find itsfaultsormistakes: khảo sát, nghiên cứu
examples: When the police examined the gun, they found Wright’s fingerprints on it.
A team of investigators is examining the crash site.
examination[U] [B2]
After careful examination, Lloyd estimated the tree was 500 years old.
examine of
Authorities still have not released findings from their examination of the dead sheep.
on closer examinationwhen you look at something more carefully
On closer examination she realized that the bag was made of plastic, not leather.
examine[T] to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it:nghiên cứu , xem xét, khảo cứu
Experts who examined the painting believe it is genuine.
Her new book examines the causes of social discontent.
A team of divers was sent down to examine the wreckage.
examine sth for sthin order to find something
The police will examine the weapon for fingerprints.

children.name: examine sth closelyto examine very carefully
examples: Before buying an antique, examine it closely to avoid buying a fake.

children.name: examine sb/sth for sth
examples: The video shows women how to examine their breasts for cancer.

children.name: take a look at
children.definition: take/have a look atsth especiallyspokento quickly examine sth to find out what is wrong with it or to find out more about it.Have a look atis less formal thanexamine, and is the usual phrase to use in everyday English: xem qua
examples: ‘You’d better take a look at this,’ she said, passing me a letter.
I’ve asked Ken to have a look at the car - it’s been making strange noises.
take/have a good look at sthlook very carefully and thoroughly
Take a good look at the photograph and see if you recognize anyone

children.name: to find out what is wrong with sth
look at
children.definition: sthphrasal verbto examine sth and try to find out what is wrong with it:
examples: You should get the doctor to look at that cut.
Can you look at my car? There’s a strange noise coming from the front wheel.
